channel.title: !--attention--!
channel.description: Can someone tell me how to connect my client to my server? :confused:

item.title: !--attention--!
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Nader Owner Nader
item.description:
@Owner_Nader wrote:

Goto Client.java and search for 127.0.0.1 And change this to your server ip… OR goto EGUI.java and change the 127.0.0.1 to your server ip.

Read full topic

item.title: !--attention--!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

zyle1992:

No. Sources RARELY come with clients, because you only need 1 client per server Revision. Have your server open a Socket to port 43594. Then, go into the client you’re going to be using, go to client.java, search for (new InetAddress(, change whatever is in the ()'s to localhost, or 127.0.0.1. And no, you do not have to PortForward to connect to a server running on YOUR computer. Only when you want other people playing on it.

his will work yea… but u can also go into client.java and search for setserver with that Ctrl+F thing…

Read full topic

Then, go into the client you’re going to be using, go to client.java, search for (new InetAddress(, change whatever is in the ()'s to localhost, or 127.0.0.1. And no, you do not have to PortForward to connect to a server running on YOUR computer. Only when you want other people playing on it.

item.title: !--attention--!
item.dc:creator: @owndscape owndscape
item.description:
@owndscape wrote:

ghostly most likely if you donwload a source it comes with a client. if it didn’t then what you’re going to want to do is if it doesnt have like an open ip where you can type the ip on the login page is go to client folders. Look for a file named Gui or EGui and open hit then hit ctl+f and search for the old servers ip and replace it with localhost then compile your client. after that you will be able to connect to let other players join just have them connect to your ip. if you want them to download your client to connect to your server all you do is go back in the EGui or the Gui and edit it to your server ip (Ex. dumbscape.no-ip.info) then you would compile it and upload to an upload site.

Read full topic
